questions.question_text: In a company meeting employees join virtually and listen. However, the SpeakerTrack device that is connected to a collaboration endpoint that follows the speaker suddenly stops working. What is the cause of this issue?

choices.B: The SpeakerTrack device is in standby mode
choices.A: The microphone panel is obstructed to detect the voice of the speaker
choices.C: The left camera or right camera is disconnected
choices.D: The SpeakerTrack is running a firmware version that is not compatible with the codec

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. is correct. Obstacles placed in front of the microphone panel, or in the sight line of the
microphones, will cause severe loss in the speaker track performance.
B, C and D. are incorrect. In order of the case, it says speakertrack suddenly stop of working, so before of the outage, the speaker track was working well. so it can not be the firmware or the cameras. standby can not be because there is a meeting running.
"Cisco TelePresence SpeakerTrack 60 INSTALLATION GUIDE"
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/telepresence/endpoint/camera/precisionhd/installation_guide/speakertrack-60-installation-guide.pdf

Ensure the codec, Speaker Track, and camera use the same software version (numbers) suffix. 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/collaboration-endpoints/telepresence-speakertrack-60/118733-config-speaker-00.html
C. The left camera or right camera is disconnected

Selected Answer: B
SpeakerTrack works in conjunction with microphones if can't determine the near location by the sound source of the speaker it won't be able to track it

Selected Answer: A
"suddenly stops working"

that means it was working before, so something is obstructing it
Could also be A but how do you block the entire mic array?
This is a terrible question. C is the only one that makes any sense.

Selected Answer: A
If it works before, it should be A, right?

choices.A: It controls the forwarding of routed packets
choices.D: It intelligently classifies traffic from different applications
choices.B: It collects traffic flow statistics on routing devices
choices.C: It allows asymmetric flows that have stateful protocols

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It is a security question but what can be done? I had this question recently 

Cisco NBAR2 (Network-Based Application Recognition) is a classification engine that provides advanced application recognition capabilities. It performs deep packet inspection on network traffic, allowing it to identify and classify applications running on the network. It can identify applications based on their port, protocol, and payload, providing Layer 3 through Layer 7 visibility into network traffic flows.

Selected Answer: D
Network Based Application Recognition (NBAR)

Selected Answer: AD
There is a table in the link shared before with this scenario

comments.content:
defienetely A&E

• Thin client plugin: Installed
• Call service-enabled user: Media is optimized
• Calls on Webex app: Media is optimized

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
answers are A & D (ENABLEVDI=1 * ,ENABLEVDI=2 **)

Selected Answer: AE
https://help.webex.com/en-us/article/19qt9v/Deployment-guide-for-Webex-App-for-Virtual-Desktop-Infrastructure-(VDI)#id_127338
msiexec /i c:\users\[username]\Downloads\Webex.msi ALLUSERS=1 ENABLEVDI=2 AUTOUPGRADEENABLED=1

https://help.webex.com/en-us/article/19qt9v/Deployment-guide-for-Webex-App-for-Virtual-Desktop-Infrastructure-(VDI)#id_127338
As per the above Link , answers are A & D (ENABLEVDI=1 * ,ENABLEVDI=2 **)

questions.question_text:
An engineer must deploy the Webex app to a Windows Virtual Desktop Infrastructure environment by using these settings:

• Thin client plugin: Installed
• Call service-enabled user: Media is optimized
• Calls on Webex app: Media is optimized

Which two command-line arguments are valid when running the installer? (Choose two.)
Where is Native Call Queuing configured in Cisco UCM?

discussion.content:
Select Queue Calls on the Hunt Pilot page to enable queuing for this Hunt Pilot..
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/unified-communications-manager-callmanager/200453-Configure-CUCM-Native-Call-Queuing-Featu.html

questions.question_text: Cisco UCM users with Cisco 8800 series IP telephones require access to a DTMF-based IVR solution. The IVR is connected via SIP through a Cisco Unified Border Element. Which configuration uses in-band signaling for the users’ keypresses?

discussion.content:
Table 2. Supported H.323 and SIP DTMF Relay Methods
 H.323 Gateway SIP Gateway
In-band cisco-rtp, rtp-nte rtp-nte

Out-of-band h245-alphanumeric, h245-signal sip-notify, sip-kpml, sip-info
